definition: to throw/to cast/left-slanting downward brush stroke (calligraphy)

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: She skimmed the soup to remove the fat.
This may be combined with a quick skim of the text of the chapter.
sentences.chinese: 這可能與相結合一迅速具有正文的本章地撇去著。

sentences.english: She skimmed the milk of its cream.
The cook skimmed the fat from the soup.
sentences.chinese: 廚師將湯上的肥油撇去。

sentences.english: Slag is lighter than iron and will float allowing it to be skimmed.
sentences.chinese: 礦渣比鐵輕，會漂浮在表面，便於撇去。

sentences.english: The surface is skimmed off while the sludge is pumped away to a separate treatment facility.
sentences.chinese: 浮面的將被撇去，淤泥被泵到另外一個處理裝置。

sentences.english: Put the creamy soup, cabbages and spices, boil them, skin away the froth.
sentences.chinese: 湯鍋放奶湯，放白菜小料燒開，撇去沫。

sentences.english: Scum the bubble when the porridge is boiling.
sentences.chinese: 粥煮沸時，請把浮沫撇去。

sentences.english: I skimmed the foam from the boiling syrup .
sentences.chinese: 我撇去了煮沸糖漿上的泡沫。

sentences.english: Strain the sauce and skim away any fat that rises to the surface.
sentences.chinese: 汁濾一下，然後撇去浮在上面的油脂。

definition: to skim froth or foam from the surface of a liquid
quick-boil/to boil for a short time
